definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: A growing sector for PopCap is mobile, which now makes up 30% of total revenue.
sentences.chinese: 而发生增长的部分则是手游，占了总收入的30%。

sentences.english: Buffett said he paid $15, 300 in payroll taxes.
sentences.chinese: 巴菲特表示他的总收入里15300美元为工资税。

sentences.english: The total income of those top filers also fell by more than half.
sentences.chinese: 这些人的总收入也下降了一半多。

sentences.english: Yes, the figure of total group outgoings exactly balances out with the total income.
sentences.chinese: 对，这部分支出额与总收入相平衡。

sentences.english: The Wikimedia Foundation receives (only) 10% of the gross total for each book sold.
sentences.chinese: 维基基金会从每本书的总收入中得到10%。

sentences.english: Expenses are deductible only to the extent that in aggregate they exceed 7 percent of gross income.
sentences.chinese: 只有在消费总额超过总收入的7%时才可免税。

sentences.english: Priority is given to families with a total household income of RM2,000.00 and below.
sentences.chinese: 优先考虑家庭总收入2千令吉或以下的家庭。

sentences.english: We have no figures for conjecturing the amount of their yield.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有数字去推断他们的总收入。

sentences.english: The cost of children's education eats up a third of a Chinese family's total income.
sentences.chinese: 中国家庭的子女教育花销占家庭总收入的三分之一。

sentences.english: In the first three quarters of this year, the per capita total income of urban households was 15, 756 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 前三季度，城镇居民家庭人均总收入15756元。

sentences.english: Low income countries had GNI per capita of US$995 or less.
sentences.chinese: 低收入国家国民总收入人均995美元或更少。

sentences.english: So his income was, in one year, $78 million.
sentences.chinese: 所以他一年的总收入有7800万。

sentences.english: The technical industrial and trade income is 2 billion RMB yuan per year.
sentences.chinese: 区内年技工贸总收入20亿人民币。
